name: Classical Greek Mythology For Everyone Multiple Choice Quiz | Humanities | 20 Questions

questions.text: Who is the only son of Odysseus and Penelope according to the epic, 'The Odyssey'?
questions.explanation:
Telemachus.

	Telemachus grew up at the court of Ithaca under the care of Mentor, Odysseus' old friend. Time came that he became annoyed with his mother's suitors and decided to evict them, so he went on a voyage to seek news about his father.

questions.text: Who is the ferryman of the dead who transports the spirits over Acheron?
questions.explanation: Charon.

questions.text: Who ordered Bellerophon to kill the Chimaera, a beast which took its shape from both a goat and a lion?
questions.explanation:
Iobates.

	Iobates was the king of Lycia who played an important role in the legends of Acrisius and Bellerophon.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'spring of forgetfulness'?
questions.explanation:
Lethe.

	The dead drink from this spring to make them forget their earthly lives.

questions.text: Who were Jason's companions in his search for the Golden Fleece?
questions.explanation: Argonauts.

questions.text: Who is the hero of the Iliad who was said to have been bathed in the river Styx except for his heel which was used to hold him?
questions.explanation:
Achilles.

	The Styx is a river said to have the power to make anyone who stepped or bathed in it invulnerable.

questions.text: An oracle declared that this man would kill his father and marry his mother. Who was the man?
questions.explanation:
Oedipus.

	He was given the hand of Laius' (his father's) widow when he bested the Sphinx, a half-lion, half-woman monster who ate anyone who passed the gate to Thebes. The widow turned out to be his mother, Jocasta. The Oracle's prophecy came true then.

questions.text: Who is the Roman equivalent of Hera?
questions.explanation:
Juno.

	Hera was the protector of women and the wife and sister of Zeus.

questions.text: Who is said to be the first woman, created by Hephaestus and Athena on the instructions of Zeus?
questions.explanation:
Pandora.

	Pandora was designed by Zeus as punishment for the human race because of the fire that Prometheus gave them, she was designed to bring men misfortune.

questions.text: Who is the son of Oeager who descended into the Underworld to fetch his wife Eurydice who had stepped on a snake and died?
questions.explanation:
Orpheus.

	Orpheus was able to convince the people in the Underworld to take Eurydice back with him because of his beautiful music, but he did not keep his promise not to look back until he reached the end, so he lost Eurydice and was not able to get her back again.

questions.text: Who is the father of Zeus?
questions.explanation: Cronus.

questions.text: Who is the daughter of Catreus, wife of Atreus, and mother of Agamemnon and Menelaus?
questions.explanation:
Aerope.

	An oracle had told Catreus that he would die at the hands of one of his children, so he gave Aerope and her sister to the traveller, Nauplius, who took them to Argos. There Aerope married Atreus and gave birth to Agamemnon and Menelaus.

questions.text: Who is Achilles' charioteer?
questions.explanation: Automedon.

questions.text: Who is the personification of Strife?
questions.explanation:
Eris.

	Eris threw the apple intended for the fairest of the godesses, which Paris had the task of awarding. This started the Trojan War.

questions.text: What is the dog of Hades called?
questions.explanation:
Cerberus.

	He watched over the Underworld and prevented living people to enter, and the dead to leave.

questions.text: Who are the Greek and Roman goddesses of Love, respectively?
questions.correct: Aphrodite and Venus & Venus and Aphrodite
questions.explanation: Aphrodite and Venus & Venus and Aphrodite.

questions.text: What was the name of a winged-horse that was eventually changed into a constellation?
questions.explanation:
Pegasus.

	Pegasus was said to spring from the Gorgon's neck when it was killed by Perseus. After his birth, Pegasus flew to Olympus and was the one who brought thunderbolts to Zeus.

questions.text: This sea goddess and daughter of Nereus was loved by Polyphemus, a Cyclops, but she loved Acis. Who was she?
questions.explanation: Galatea.

questions.text: Who is the Greek god of War?
questions.explanation: Ares.

questions.text: Who is the soothsayer that predicted to Polyphemus, a Sicilian Cyclops, that Odysseus would blind him?
questions.explanation: Telemus.
